place.name: NICHOLASTON
place.gazetteerText: NICHOLASTON, a parish in Swansea district, Glamorgan; on Oxwich bay, in the Gower peninsula, 1¾mile E N E of Penrice, and 10 W S W of Swansea r. station. It contains the hamlet of Manselfield; and its post town is Swansea. Acres, 731; of which 105 are water. Real property, £427. Pop., 109. Houses, 26. The property is subdivided. The living is a rectory, united with the rectory of Oxwich, in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £224.* Patron,R. M. Talbot, Esq. The church is ancient and good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
